entries.title: Looking after thousands of Northern Ireland's abandoned mines
entries.description: BBC News NI is granted rare access to one of the 2,500 disused mines across Northern Ireland.

entries.title: December strikes: 1,200 army personnel to cover for ambulances and border force
entries.description: Plans for military personnel to keep front-line services running are in place, the government says.

entries.title: Heineken Champions Cup: Montpellier 10-21 Ospreys - Welsh region end European drought
entries.description: Ospreys record their first win in Europe in two years as they battle to a 21-10 win against Montpellier.

entries.title: Claressa Shields: Briton Savannah Marshall triggers rematch clause and wants UK bout
entries.description: Briton Savannah Marshall triggers her rematch clause with undisputed middleweight champion Claressa Shields.

entries.title: Eurovision 2023: Ukraine chooses Tvorchi for song contest from bomb shelter TV studio
entries.description: A Kyiv metro station and bomb shelter is transformed into a TV studio for the selection programme.

entries.title: Bible John: The forgotten women at the heart of a serial killer mystery
entries.description: Uncovering the stories of three women thought to have been murdered by the same man in 1960s Glasgow.

entries.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'bright lights'
entries.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

entries.title: The Amazon reef that may be threatened by oil drilling
entries.description: Scientists say a rare reef habitat near the mouth of the Amazon is at risk from oil exploration.

entries.title: World Cup 2022 Fans count down the hours to final
entries.description: Supporters in Buenos Aires and Paris are preparing for an historic World Cup final clash.

entries.title: Watch: Sportscene - Scottish Premiership highlights
entries.description: Watch highlights of Saturday's Scottish Premiership matches on BBC Scotland's Sportscene.

entries.title: Taraneh Alidoosti: Top Iran actress who supported protests arrested
entries.description: Taraneh Alidoosti is accused of "spreading falsehoods" about the protest movement gripping Iran.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Argentina and France meet in the final at the Lusail Stadium
entries.description: Argentina are aiming to lift the World Cup for the first time since 1986, while France are hoping to win successive tournaments.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Argentina v France - Pablo Zabaleta on what it's like to play in a World Cup final
entries.description: Former Argentina defender Pablo Zabaleta explains what it feels like to be one of only 444 men to have played in a World Cup final.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Watch analysis of Croatia's goals against Morocco
entries.description: BBC Match of the Day's Alex Scott, Jurgen Klinsmann and Micah Richards analyse the two brilliant goals which mean Croatia finish third at the Qatar 2022 World Cup.

entries.title: Hundreds turn out for Solihull lake-death vigil
entries.description: People gather to remember four young boys who died after falling into a frozen lake.

entries.title: Emma Raducanu says she is injury free and feels 'good' following exhibition match
entries.description: Emma Raducanu says she is now injury free and feeling "good" following her exhibition match with Wimbledon runner-up Ons Jabeur on Friday.

entries.title: Pakistan v England: Rehan Ahmed's promising debut in Karachi
entries.description: Rehan Ahmed may have to get used to plaudits after a promising first day in Test cricket, writes Stephan Shemilt.

entries.title: Burnley 3-1 Middlesbrough: Manuel Benson scores twice for Championship leaders
entries.description: Manuel Benson scores twice as Burnley beat Middlesbrough and extend their lead at the top of the Championship to six points.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Croatia beat Morocco 2-1 to seal third place at Qatar World Cup
entries.description: Croatia show their class once more by clinching their third top-three finish at the World Cup with a 2-1 third-place play-off victory over history-makers Morocco.

entries.title: Laura Kuenssberg: 'No coups, no plots - nobody cares'
entries.description: The atmosphere at Westminster is the calmest it's been for a long time - but is it enough for the Tory Party?

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Mislav Orsic curls in 'absolute peach' to give Croatia lead
entries.description: Mislav Orsic on the left, just inside the area and he bends a brilliant strike that is out of Morocco goalkeeper Bono's reach.

entries.title: Dresden Green Vault robbery jewels recovered after heist
entries.description: Police say 31 objects from Dresden's Green Vault have been recovered after a €113m robbery in 2019.

entries.title: Heineken Champions Cup: Exeter Chiefs 44-14 Bulls - Cowan-Dickie hat-trick in bonus-point success
entries.description: Exeter Chiefs claim second successive Champions Cup win after three Luke Cowan-Dickie tries help them overcome South Africa's Bulls.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Putin meets generals as reports of offensive grow
entries.description: Senior Ukrainian commanders say Russia could be planning a new attack on Kyiv early next year.

entries.title: Poland grenade incident: Police chief confirms unusual Ukrainian gift
entries.description: Jaroslaw Szymczyk says he accidentally set off a grenade launcher given to him as a gift by Ukraine.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Josko Gvardiol scores brilliant header after clever Croatia free-kick routine
entries.description: Josko Gvardiol opens the scoring for Croatia in the third-place play-off against Morocco after a brilliantly worked free-kick

entries.title: FIS Snowboard Cross World Cup: Britain's Charlotte Bankes wins gold
entries.description: Britain's Charlotte Bankes follows her bronze medal on Friday with gold at the Snowboard Cross World Cup in Cervinia, Italy.

entries.title: Aberdeen 0-1 Celtic: Callum McGregor scores late winner for champions
entries.description: Returning captain Callum McGregor scored a fantastic late winner as Celtic eventually broke down a stubborn Aberdeen side to restore their nine-point lead in the Scottish Premiership.

entries.title: Brixton Academy: Woman dies after Asake concert crush
entries.description: A woman has died and two others remain critically injured after a crush at the Brixton O2 Academy.

entries.title: Frankie Dettori says he will ride for one final season before retiring
entries.description: Jockey Frankie Dettori announces that 2023 will be his final season after riding more than 3,300 winners in a 35-year career.

entries.title: Panicked diners flee fire at London restaurant
entries.description: Dramatic video shows flames inside the MNKY HSE restaurant in London's Mayfair as guests rushed to get outside.

entries.title: Berlin AquaDom aquarium: Police not seeking suspects over explosion
entries.description: Berlin police say a tweet asking for help in tracking down suspects linked to the incident is fake.

entries.title: Pakistan v England: Rehan Ahmed takes two wickets on debut in Karachi
entries.description: Rehan Ahmed takes important wickets as England bowl out Pakistan for 304 on the first day of the final Test in Karachi.

entries.title: Shanghai schools to go online as Covid spreads in China
entries.description: The easing of strict lockdown measures has led to growing concerns over the spread of Covid in China.

entries.title: World Championships: GB's Ben Proud wins silver while Anna Hopkin takes bronze
entries.description: Britain's Ben Proud narrowly fails to defend his 50m freestyle short course world title, while Anna Hopkin wins bronze.

entries.title: Homes flooded after north London water mains burst
entries.description: Residents are evacuated from their homes when water floods the streets in the middle of the night.

entries.title: A-League: Melbourne City-Melbourne Victory game abandoned after spectator injures player
entries.description: The A-League derby between Melbourne City and Melbourne Victory is abandoned after a player is injured by a spectator during a pitch invasion.

entries.title: Lionel Messi: Inside Argentina captain's quest for World Cup 2022 glory
entries.description: As Lionel Messi bids to lead Argentina to World Cup glory, his biography writer Guillem Balague takes a closer look at his journey.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: How family unity has helped Kylian Mbappe to stardom
entries.description: As Kylian Mbappe looks to win his second World Cup aged just 23, French football writer Julien Laurens looks at the striker's journey to the top.

entries.title: Brisbane nativity camels returned safely after stroll
entries.description: The three animals were seen wandering the Brisbane's streets after opening the gate of their enclosure.

entries.title: FIH Pro League: Great Britain men beat Netherlands in shootout but women lose
entries.description: The Great Britain men's hockey team get a bonus point after beating the Netherlands in a shootout in the FIH Pro League.

entries.title: House bills: Grant Shapps shares energy saving tips from inside his house
entries.description: During a tour of his home, Grant Shapps faces questions about the government's intervention on energy bills.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Russia could launch more heavy strikes, Zelensky warns
entries.description: Work is continuing to restore electricity following a ninth wave of heavy Russian air strikes on Friday.

entries.title: Twitter reinstates banned journalists' accounts
entries.description: Elon Musk suspended some journalists' accounts after accusing them of sharing location data about him.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Choose your winners for BBC Sport's World Cup awards
entries.description: Who scored the best goal at the Fifa World Cup and what was the standout moment? Choose your favourites in our World Cup awards.

entries.title: Saturday's transfer gossip: Griezmann, Ronaldo, Gakpo, Isco, Amrabat, Rabiot, Bellingham
entries.description: Man Utd consider move for Atletico Madrid and France star Antoine Griezmann, Wolves make move for Isco, Cristiano Ronaldo could be preparing to announce his retirement, plus more.

entries.title: Fans fall silent for boys who died in Solihull lake fall
entries.description: Silences and a vigil will be held for Jack Johnson, brothers Finlay and Samuel Butler and Thomas Stewart.

entries.title: Cost of living: Parents ask for Calpol and baby wipes for Christmas
entries.description: With many families struggling to heat homes or feed children, presents are "on the backburner".

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Argentina v France: 'Win or lose, the joy of Lionel Messi will be missed' - Gary Lineker
entries.description: Lionel Messi's World Cup story is almost over but, however it ends, Gary Lineker feels things will be a lot less enjoyable without him.

entries.title: Energy discount phishing: Robbed of £25,000 in text scam
entries.description: Victim support groups warn that scams targeting those looking to save money have soared.

entries.title: Angelina Jolie steps down as UN refugee envoy
entries.description: The Hollywood star says she now wants to work with groups led by people most directly affected by conflict.

entries.title: Peru protests: High-level talks amid deepening crisis
entries.description: Top politicians and church leaders seek to end deadly protests over the ousting of President Pedro Castillo.

entries.title: Capitol riot: Committee to seek charges for Trump - reports
entries.description: The committee will reportedly seek an unprecedented charge of insurrection against an ex-US president.

entries.title: The 'one-in-a-million' denied a glowing future
entries.description: Detectives say Ross McCullam had the potential to kill again after he brutally murdered his girlfriend.

entries.title: Cost of living: The 'lucky' caravan couple facing a freezing future
entries.description: The BBC visits a Lincolnshire warm space and speaks with a couple seeking respite from the chill.

entries.title: World Cup: What happened to England's 1966 shirts?
entries.description: England's famous red jerseys are perhaps the greatest visual reminder of their World Cup triumph.

entries.title: Train strikes to disrupt weekend before Christmas
entries.description: People are being advised not to travel on the railways as workers continue strikes on Saturday.

entries.title: Week in pictures: 10 - 16 December 2022
entries.description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

entries.title: P-22, Hollywood's celebrity mountain lion, ends his reign
entries.description: His charisma and unusual residence made P-22 an icon - but the mountain lion's days are numbered.

entries.title: Leo Varadkar to become taoiseach as Micheál Martin steps down
entries.description: Fine Gael's Leo Varadkar will become leader again under a deal with government partners Fianna Fáil.

entries.title: Christian nationalists: Wanting to put God into US government
entries.description: A right-wing Christian movement in the US is set on what it sees as its divine mission.

entries.title: Angel Lynn: Kidnap victim's home transformation begins
entries.description: Work to transform the home of a woman left paralysed in a botched kidnapping gets under way.

entries.title: Strictly Come Dancing: Final four set for ballroom showdown
entries.description: Hamza Yassin, Fleur East, Helen Skelton and Molly Rainford all hope to land the glitterball trophy.

entries.title: London International Horse Show: Charlotte Fry and Glamourdale win dressage World Cup
entries.description: World champions Charlotte Fry and Glamourdale win the Dressage World Cup freestyle with a new personal best at the London International Horse Show.
